title: Water contains the elements oxygen and hydrogen. Where did the hydrogen in the water come from in this reaction? - Quora

response.answer_text: The big bang. In the beginning there was the quantum soup. Eventually, it expanded and cooled off enough to form subatomic particles. Electrons, protons, and neutrons formed. electrons and protons paired up to form hydrogen atoms, H These then paired up to form hydrogen molecules, H2. Suns formed, created helium and other atoms, In their death throes, they created even more and heavier atoms. At some point, they create oxygen. All the elements in the universe, apart from hydrogen, come from stars, mostly dying stars. The rest is history.
